TechCrunch Disrupt London 2014.description: Appilepsy - a mobile app that runs an intelligent algorithm in the background of your phone which analyses your phone's 3D accelerometer data in real-time to detect if you're having a convulsive epileptic seizure.

details.Award:
Second place 
Most creative use of Nexmo's API

MLH Launch Hack 2014.description:
JoinPack - an iOS app for meeting new people during social events based on othersâ€™ public profile (e.g. LinkedIn, Facebook, etc.). 
Photos by C Ji and Major League Hacking.

EikonHack 2014.description: PerFeed - a mobile app for showing news feed more personally.

HackLondon 2015.description: HackLondon was my first hackthon where I attended as an organizer. Due to the limitation of audio and visual facilities in the auditorium, I made an app that was used to mirror what the camera captured to the display (HackCam). Photos by C Ji, Nikita L, Manoj N.

details.Organizer:
King's College London Tech Society, 
University College London TechSoc, 
University College London Entrepreneurs

MLH Landing Hack 2015.description:
It was a great chance for me to meet new people, to learn new stuff, and to acquire more skills on running a hackathon. 
 Photos by C Ji, Manoj N, courtesy of MLH.

Appilepsy.description: Appilepsy runs an algorithm which analyses the phone's accelerometer data to detect if you're having a convulsive epileptic seizure. We are currently working optimizing our algorithm, making the user experience more intuitional.

HackCam.description: Inspired by HackLondon, HackCam is used for recording and mirroring what the iPhone camera captures, and it is now in the phase of beta testing. On MLH Landing Hack, HackCam was used as a part of livestreaming. However, there are still things that can be greatly improved.

details.Target User: People who manage livestreaming but have limitation on audio and visual facilities
